meta_description: The Los Altos History Museum mission is collecting, preserving, and interpreting the history of the Los Altos area.

admission_text:
Hit enter to search or ESC to close

# Plan Your Visit

## Admission & Hours

The History Museum complex is admission **FREE**.  
**Thursday – Sunday, noon-4pm.**

**We are pleased to welcome you to the:**

  * Changing Exhibition: [10,000 Memories](https://www.losaltoshistory.org/exhibit/stories-of-partition/) (opens Jan 29)
  * Permanent Exhibition: [Making Connections: Stories from the Land](https://www.losaltoshistory.org/exhibit/making-connections/)
  * J. Gilbert Smith House Gallery: [Meet the Smiths](https://www.losaltoshistory.org/exhibit-archive/upcoming/)
  * [J. Gilbert Smith House](https://www.losaltoshistory.org/exhibit/j-gilbert-smith-house/)
  * [Agricultural Exhibit & Gardens](https://www.losaltoshistory.org/exhibit/outdoor-agricultural-exhibit/)
  * [Museum Store](https://www.losaltoshistory.org/support/shop/) for an array of curated items

__

### Phone Numbers & Extensions

  * Main Number: 650.948.9427 
    * __Membership: x14  

    * __Volunteering: x16
    * __Event Rental: x12

## **Group Tours**

Groups of 10 or more may request a [guided tour](/visit/tours/). Please call 650.948.9427 x16 to arrange a tour.

The Museum is open to the public Thursday–Sunday, noon-4pm. Tours outside our open hours, or tours during open hours that require a docent, are $5/person, or $50/group for schools or nonprofits.

## **Event Rentals**

Host your event at the Museum! The Museum is available for wedding rentals* on Fridays, Saturdays & Sundays, and other special even...
